name: Pathogens-vm
tagline: A virtual machine with Sanger pathogens software installed
body:
A virtual machine made by the Pathogen Informatics team of the Sanger Institute, which
includes the following software developed by the Pathogens group.
* [Artemis](http://www.sanger.ac.uk/resources/software/artemis/)
  and [ACT](http://www.sanger.ac.uk/resources/software/act/)
* [Gubbins](http://sanger-pathogens.github.io/gubbins/)
* [IVA](http://sanger-pathogens.github.io/iva/)
* [PAGIT](https://www.sanger.ac.uk/resources/software/pagit/), which includes
  [ABACAS](http://abacas.sourceforge.net/),
  [IMAGE](http://sourceforge.net/projects/image2/),
  [iCORN](http://icorn.sourceforge.net/) and
  [RATT](http://ratt.sourceforge.net/)
* [REAPR](https://www.sanger.ac.uk/resources/software/reapr/)

The virtual machine is based on
[Bio-Linux](http://environmentalomics.org/bio-linux/),
and so it also includes all the
[software that comes with Bio-Linux](http://environmentalomics.org/bio-linux-software-list/).


How to get and use the virtual machine
======================================

1. Install [VirtualBox](https://www.virtualbox.org/) on your computer.
2. Download the
   [latest virtual machine](ftp://ftp.sanger.ac.uk/pub/pathogens/pathogens-vm/pathogens-vm.latest.ova)
   or browse the
   [directory of older versions](ftp://ftp.sanger.ac.uk/pub/pathogens/).
3. Start VirtualBox and choose File -> Import Appliance from the menu
4. Choose the downloaded OVA file from step 2 and click 'Continue'.
5. Click on import and wait for VirtualBox to import the virtual machine.
6. Start the virtual machine.

The password for the default user 'manager' is 'manager'.

Contact
=======
For any feedback, questions or help, please email path-help AT sanger DOT ac DOT uk.


For developers - how to build a new virtual machine
===================================================
Instructions can be found on the
[pathogens-vm github repository](https://github.com/sanger-pathogens/pathogens-vm).
